p: Since the majority of the known morphological descriptions of silphion were reported by Theophrastus [ 9] and Pliny the Elder [ 13], their descriptions will be used to illustrate the similarities between the parts of silphion plant and those of Ferula drudeana. In addition, despite their exaggerated representations, numismatic figures of the silphion plant on the Cyrenaic coins were utilized to compare the macro-morphology of F. drudeana to the silphion plant.
